thread.title: Failure-in-Chief: During Obama’s Last Months in Office, GDP Plummets to 1.9%
thread.title_full: Failure-in-Chief: During Obama’s Last Months in Office, GDP Plummets to 1.9%

author: John S. Roberts
title: Failure-in-Chief: During Obama’s Last Months in Office, GDP Plummets to 1.9%
text:
09:40pm   
Not one time during Barack Obama’s eight years in office did the GDP reach 3%. 
Quite the legacy 44 leaves behind. 
But, we all knew Obama was coming into office to enact social change and divide the nation on racial grounds, not to fix things that actually matter. 
Right now, the economy has slowed to 1.9% growth. 
From MarketWatch : 
The U.S. economy’s expansion slowed in the fourth quarter, and annual growth failed to reach 3% for an 11th straight year, reflecting the huge hurdles the Trump administration faces in trying to speed up a 7½-year-old expansion. 
Gross domestic product, the official score card for the economy, expanded at a 1.9% annual clip from October to December, the Commerce Department said . That’s a marked drop from a 3.5% growth rate in the third quarter and below the 2.2% MarketWatch-compiled consensus. 
In early trading, the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, -0.04% was little changed. The Dow finished at a record high Thursday, however, and is now up 25% over the last 52 weeks. 
For the full year, the U.S. grew just 1.6%, compared with its 2.6% clip in 2015. It was the weakest performance since 2011. The last time the U.S. topped 3% growth — the historical average is 3.3% — was in 2005. 
  has vowed to push the economy into higher gear with an aggressive combination of tax cuts, reduced regulations and more government spending on public works. Yet economists say it will take time before the U.S. reaps any benefits. 
Most predict the economy will grow around 2% or a bit faster in 2017. If Trump’s approach works, the payoff is unlikely to come until the end of the year or early 2018, they say. 
Trump’s approach will work. 
He’s a businessman. He knows how to get the job done. 
Soon, we’ll be at 3%-plus! LIKE this article?
